intro: Fagara tragodes, commonly known as the Trinidadian evergreen or Trinidadian holly, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Trinidad and Tobago. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces small, bright red berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Fagara tragodes is often used in local landscaping due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
